name: places/ChIJD2lwxQ1cwokRsiHr0SpTE-M

displayName.text: Rama Beauty and African Hair Braiding

formattedAddress: 1934 Madison Ave Store 2, New York, NY 10035, USA

authorAttributions.displayName: Rama Beauty and African Hair Braiding
Rama Beauty and African Hair Braiding

adrFormatAddress: 1934 Madison Ave Store 2, New York, NY 10035, USA

originalText.text: Let me lead with … my braiders were super pleasant and friendly As is the owner but, we had an 8am appointment and were not seen until 9:35. For small knotless braids i sat for 6hours which i thought was excessive. The price was decent but my parts were awful and the braider fed hair into the braid pretty far from the scalp. So a lot of my braids look like they are hanging by a thread. I have very fine hair and my parts were uneven and so tiny that she had a hard time grabbing hair let alone feeding the hair into braid. The braids at the top of my hair cannot be styled into a bun or back so not really the versatility of the knotless look i wanted. I will not be returning. The place was filled - every square inch.

originalText.text: Please do not come here if you have 4C hair. She blow dried my hair really harshly with extremely high heat. I was crying from the pain and asked if she could lower it, and she said my hair was too thick. She said her hands would hurt if she tried to do it, and refused to do my hair. Since I was crying, she eventually said she could do some braids which I didn’t want, but she was being really rude and kept complaining about my hair, so I left. I have gone to many braiding shops, and that has never happened to me before. I will never go here again.

originalText.text: I recently went to Rama beauty and I loved my experience. My friend recommended me to the shop and also to Amy. Amy did an amazing job on my boho twist. She was very nice and braided efficiently. If you go ask for Amy!! Otherwise Rama and her whole staff is very nice and can do good work. Book in advance to secure your spot otherwise you can walk in.

text.text: I recently went to Rama beauty and I loved my experience. My friend recommended me to the shop and also to Amy. Amy did an amazing job on my boho twist. She was very nice and braided efficiently. If you go ask for Amy!! Otherwise Rama and her whole staff is very nice and can do good work. Book in advance to secure your spot otherwise you can walk in.

originalText.text:
I’m giving this place one star because my braids are VERY thin, causing the style to look displeasing and when I brought it to the stylist’s attention, she blamed it on my very then edges (which I asked her not to braid). But I guess we get what we pay for.

I traveled 90minutes and sat for 7 hours for my hair to look the way it does- unacceptable!!

I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone. Go to Brooklyn where the shops are clean, they have wash sinks and hand soap & toilet paper in the restrooms. My hair was always done to my satisfaction and in a clean, comfortable environment.

originalText.text: Please beware. They claim they do any size/any length but when it comes down to it, they short you. I was very excited to come to this shop. When I got there I waited an hour before they started and I showed them a picture and video of what I wanted. After the person working on me finished the first braid, I told her it was okay and told her I wanted THIGH length. It took them SEVEN HOURS to finish my hair, which is excessive, and when I was finally finished I was extremely DISAPPOINTED. Not only did my braids not even touch my BUTT… they curled my ends without me asking?!!! I was enraged and when I told them this wasn’t what I asked for, she gave ME an attitude.. they redipped my hair, I guess to get it “straight” and now I have this weird crispy end look going on. I hate my hair. Don’t waste your time. It’s also PACKED in there.
